newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK signs HK$1.8 bln contract with Aoki.
newsitem.headline: HK signs HK$1.8 bln contract with Aoki.

text.p: Japanese construction company Aoki Corp signed a HK$1.8 billion contract with the Hong Kong government on Tuesday to build a water treatment works in the territory, government said in a statement.
The contract covers the construction of all civil engineering structures and electrical and mechanical equipment for the treatment works in Yuen Long, Hong Kong, it said.
The works, which will serve existing projectd housing and industrial developments in the rural western New Territories, is expected to be completed in August 1999, the governemnt said.
